cheatsheet.title: Create a project for CXF Web services

intro.description:
This cheat sheet will demonstrate how to create a Dynamic Web Project and enable it for CXF JAX-WS Web service development.
If you need help at any step, click the help button in the top right corner (?).

item.title: Open the Java EE perspective
item.description: When working with JAX-WS Web services, you should use the Java EE perspective. If you already have the Java EE perspective active, you may skip this step by clicking the Click to Skip button. If not, select Window -> Open Perspective -> Other... from the main menu and choose Java EE in the resulting Open Perspective dialog box.

item.title: Create a Dynamic Web Project
item.description:
Before creating a JAX-WS Web Service, we need a project to put it in. Perform the following steps to create an Dynamic Web Project.
Select File -> New -> Project... from the main menu, expand the Web category within the resulting New Project dialog box and choose Dynamic Web Project.
On the first page of the wizard enter a Project name:, select Apache Tomcat as the Target runtime and click Finish.

item.title: Enable JAX-WS Web service developement
item.description:
Enable a Dynamic Web Project for Apache CXF Web services development by right-clicking on the project and selecting Properties.
In the Project Facets page enable the CXF 2.x Web Services facet by selecting the check box and click OK.
